page.title: 10Wootton Village - general
page.content: During the past 900 years seueral different{spellings}of the name Wootton have been recorded.These are Otone(Domesday Book), Wutton, Wotton, Woutton and Wutton.The name probably means "WOOD-FARM".It is mentioned in the Domesday Book as "land of Albert of Lorraine" and as having 20 villagers and 6 slaves. It is a widely scattered village about 6 kilometres south-east of Bedford. It has several{"ends"}- Keeley, Cause, Bott's, Tagg's, Church and Hall End. These are collections of farm and cottage buildings. Wootton Woods is owned by Mr.E.W.Stratford. It is a{conservation {area}where rare wild plants, insects, Barking Deer and game thrive. The village is surrounded by farmland, and the area around St.Mary's Church is a conservation area.
